data.title: Desert shellmap Lua maintenance
data.body: After lessons learned from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6377. Essentially a followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6284 to make use of the new reinforcement global and time utils. As the ant random number dice does not work (for me) at all, I replaced it with a Halloween easter egg. I also brought back the chinook reinforcements from the original C# implementation.

data.title: Ported Allies 01 to the New Lua API
data.body:
Changes include:
- Added an objectives panel with proper instructions that get updated during the mission.
- ~~The ore management hack in TickIdle has been removed (as in the desert-shellmap).~~
- The soviet base alert got now got a real alarm sound to make enemy behavior easier to understand.

data.title: subtitles proof of concept (Hacky)
data.body:
Need some answers from lead developers to questions such as:
- "how to fit this in with the existing yaml?"
- "to what extent should messages be reported in text? And should there be groups of voices to enable?"
- "make sure announcements like the commando laugh, cloak activate and superpower warnings are narrated."
- "is this to be shared with the existing chat dialog?"

Added some random subtitles to the RA mod to show.
![arf](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1812087/4100239/fa7c305e-3089-11e4-9786-811858e5b487.jpg)

data.title: SpawnsCorpse from RenderInfantry should be moved into own trait
data.body: In order to make it infantry-independent and usable by other actor types.

data.title: Dynamic map filter
data.body: Input box (top left in map browser) which could serve as dynamic map finder while creating a game. I dont know if gui core would make it difficult to code or not, but it would be great feature, saving time for those with hundreds maps

data.title: Game descriptions in multiplayer pane
data.body: It would be very useful, to prevent disagreements about created game and to save time for ppl arguing (e.g. description "Free for all")

data.title: Renamed InfDeath to DeathType
data.body: Prerequisite for the upcoming replacement of RenderInfantry's SpawnsCorpse with an infantry-independent WithDeathAnimation trait.

data.title: Fixed D2k infantry death sequences
data.body: Closes #6314.

data.title: Build palette tooltips flicker when moving the mouse
data.body: Not sure when this was introduced.

data.title: Added a server message about nickname changes
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6134 and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6108.

data.title: Removed hard-coded squishy sounds to avoid confusion
data.body: These file names differ slightly between Tiberian Dawn and Red Alert/Tiberian Sun. The defaults are historically grown and changed back and forth so we already lost an overview. This partly reverts https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6366 to fix squishy sounds in the RA mod again.

data.title: Removed Pseudo-Fullscreen
Minor sound fixes for RA and TS
data.body: All of them squish-related.

data.title: Lobby - Chat/MOTD: Lines that are URLs are blue and click-able
Adds ability to paste text (ctrl/cmd+v) into chat
Lobby: URL's are now highlighted and clickable
Moved SellSounds from Building to Sellable & added upgrade to rules
data.body: Note: It will add Sellable to actor rules with a warning.

data.title: Fix RA MadTank chrono after activation/deployment.
data.body:
Implement (new) `IChronoshiftableCondition` in `MadTank`.
Prevents MadTank from being chronoshifted after activating.

data.title: Player connection status report.
data.body: A small but sorely needed feature. Up to date information if players are disconnected or not.

data.title: Paradrop beacon doesn't disappear after plane got shot down.
data.body:
My paratrooper plane got shot down because it flew over an enemy base and took enough hits.

The beacon where they were supposed to drop hasn't disappeared since.

data.title: Cloaked APCs are no longer unstoppable harrassment machines.
data.body: Grabbing a cloak upgrade crate enabled APCs to load and unload units without uncloaking. Especially within the first 5 minutes of a game, players can load up with engineers and appear and disappear without warning as much as they like. Imagine how bad it'd be with commandos.

data.title: [IDEA] Destrucable cliffs for Red Alert/Tiberian Dawn
data.body:
I'm sure the hardest part would be getting someone who can make the graphics. Maybe even reverse destructible cliffs so you can block and path instead of opening it up? 

Just something simple that add some variety to things. We need them for Tiberian Sun either way.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/4104855-idea-destrucable-cliffs-for-red-alert-tiberian-dawn?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: RevealsShroud yaml value problem
data.body:
RevealsShroud: Range - seems not working anymore without 'c0' suffix. There was no info anywhere about changing manner of assigning value to this variable, wiki also states, that value should be clean integer, but its seems not working.

for e.g. BaseProvider: Range - still accepts only clean integer

I am asking if is this bug, or intended change? becouse I must do corrections in maps yaml and update it to Openra Resource Center..... and if that bug would be fixed soon - updating maps would be unnecessary...

![revealsshroud](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6244620/4078931/94065116-2ed0-11e4-9f0e-8217fce68423.png)

data.title: AI attacks the Creeps base first at my map.
data.body:
This is not one of games real maps but this is very annoying. Also build defensive buildings at this way.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7933210/4075639/1ab80282-2eb2-11e4-873c-4ad69332cd7b.png)

Solving this problem may be add priority to enemies. Lower to creeps and higher and same to other players.

data.title: Toggle notifications dialogs.
data.body:
For the people who have their volumes down or need accessibility options, any way to toggle text notifications like a unit-ready or construction-complete or base-under-attack?
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/4088016-toggle-notifications-dialogs?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Different Notifications Narrator/Sounds for different teams
data.body:
There is only one narrator for any faction in any mod, with notifications.yaml only accepting one .aud file at a time.

What about using the same suffix effect in the voices.yaml for narrating too? Make it sound like each faction's interface has different narration and sound effects.

data.title: 'All mods' checkbox in multiplayer pane. Joining directly to other mods pending games.
data.body:
We are all suffering lack of players in other mods than Red Alert. U are not going out from RA coz u know that everyone is sitting at RA, so waiting for players in other mods is waste of time (others thinks the same - closed circle)...

My proposition is to add 'All mods' checkbox to show all pending compatible games from all mods, and possibility to join those games from any activated currently mod.

This will allow RA players to play some Dune or Tiberium Dawn from time to time for a change.

![multiplayer-all-mods](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6244620/4068204/64f9c79e-2e36-11e4-8c04-6cd6322687df.png)

data.title: Fixed sh31 tile
data.body: In order to fix #6195 .

data.title: Paste text from clipboard into chat input boxes (ctrl/cmd+v)
data.body:
General Improvements (all mods):
Added ability to paste text from clipboard into chat input boxes (ctrl/cmd+v)

data.title: Sub-cell co-path-finding with dynamic range
data.body:
NOTE: continues work from #6208.
Sub-cell aware co-path-finding with dynamic range

Continued changes from #6208 to IMove.
- Removed non-sub-cell constructors from Move
- Enhanced path-finder
- Sub-cell aware co-path-finding - tries to use the same path for actors from the same cell.
- Forward adjacent co-path-finding - tries to use a cached path from a forward adjacent cell.
